EDUCATIONAL TELEVISION AND RADIO CENTER
1610 Washtenaw Avenue
Ann Arbor, Michigan
April 16, 1957
Mr* Purton Paulu, President
National Association of Educational
Broadcasters
Station KTJOM
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis llj., Minnesota
Dear Burton:
This is a follow-up on your letter of April !{. and our tele-*
phone call of this morning. As I understand it, you will get in
touch with tiie other members of your Committee, suggesting
that we meet for luncheon Tuesday noon. May Uj., and as long as
is necessary through the afternoon. This is in lieu of a possible
meeting at the Ohio Conference, which you and I agreed probably
would be better under the circumstances.
I»ll not attempt to respond to the comments in your letter,
since we'll have an opportunity to talk when you are here, except
for two items: In the first place, I do not believe it is good for
the Committee to meet apart from the President of the Center,
I agree with you in your general definition of the role of
the Committee and it is an emerging one, to be sure. There is
no occasion for the Committee to meet in advance of board meet¬
ings because the role of the Committee is sufficiently different
from that which originally was envisioned as to make it unnecessary
for such arrangements to taku place, We have assumed that a
couple of meetings a year, plus the opportunity to correspond
with the Committee or talk with them by telephone in the interim,
is sufficient. All this of course can be reviewed, if you like,
when we meet.
I would suggest you indicate that the Committee plan to meet
at the Center building, 2320 Washtenaw Avenue, at 12 o'clock noon
on Tuesday, and we *11 either have our lunch here or go to some
nearby spot for these activities. It will be good to see you at that
time.
Why don't you come to the Affiliates* Meeting as the repre¬
sentative of the NASD at this time rather than have Harry Skornia
come? V/e are getting a pretty good-sized group, and 1 think there
rolfSht just be a possible misunderstanding if we added too many
observers from any group, Don't misunderstand this, but it occurs
to me that it might be possible for you to substitute for Harry at
this session if you care to do so*
Let me know when you're coming in and your need for room
reservations in connection with the meetings.
Sincerely yours,
M. Newburn
KKNsmjl President
